se.cbb.jprime.prm

Class Relation

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.cbb.jprime.prm.Relation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Relation>

    public class Relation
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Relation>
    Represents a relation between two PRM classes (analogous to a link between two relational database tables). The relation is specified by the two fixed attributes A and B representing the link.

    The order of A and B matters, since the directionality in a dependency slot chain from a child attribute to a parent is assumed to flow from A to B. The relation automatically adds itself to the class of A.

    At the moment we allow only one-to-one relations and many-to-one relations between A and B respectively, (implying that A and B represent foreign and primary keys respectively). Moreover, it is assumed that the values of B are unique. Many-to-many relations should be resolved using an intermediary PRM class.

    Two instances of this class are considered equal if they refer to the same attributes. All other properties are ignored.

    Author:
    Joel Sj√∂strand.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns a concatenated string thus: Alpha.Foo-Beta.Bar for class Alpha, attribute Foo and class Beta, attribute Bar, (corresponding to A and B respectively).

        This string may also be used for finding identical Relation instances.

        Returns:
        a unique name representation of the relation.

      • getType

        public Relation.Type getType()
        Returns the relation type.
        Returns:
        the type.

      • canBeSlot

        public boolean canBeSlot()
        Returns whether this relation can act as a 'slot' in a 'slot chain' in a parent-child dependency.
        Returns:
        true if it can be part of a slot chain; otherwise false.

      • getIndex

        public int getIndex(int aIdx)
        Given a record of PRM class A, follows a relation and returns the index of the record in B, making the assumption that there is only one such record.
        Parameters:
        aIdx - the entity index in A.
        Returns:
        the corresponding entity index in B.
